{"step_by_step_thinking": "The olfactory receptors are located in the olfactory epithelium, which is found in the upper part of the nasal cavity. This area is located on the roof of the nasal cavity, the superior nasal concha, and the corresponding septum. Therefore, the olfactory receptors are present in both the lateral wall and the nasal septum above the superior concha.", "answer_choice": "C"}
